item.title: Deeplearning.ai tree
item.description: [[notes/Computer Science|Computer Science]] These are the Deeplearning.ai short courses I want to take in the next month. They’re each only a hour long and free.

item.title: PageRank paper
item.description: [[notes/Computer Science|Computer Science]] Starting off with the canonical PageRank paper (shortened version) : Fascinating appendix on the inherent bias of advertising

item.title: Philosophers with something to say on AI
item.description: [[notes/Philosophy|Philosophy]] [[notes/Computer Science|Computer Science]] Sourced from the Conversations with Tyler Podcast episode with Reid Hoffman Pierce Wittgenstein Gareth Evans theories of reference Christopher Peacocke concept work Neuroscience philosophy

item.title: Plan of action for learning coding
item.description: [[notes/Computer Science|Computer Science]] The big question is whether to use LLMs while going through these resources. If LLMs such as Gemini can seem to problem solve effectively, it seems that focusing more on knowing what’s possible and software architecture and building projects fast matters more.

item.title: Rationality and Choice Course Notes
item.description: [[notes/Philosophy|Philosophy]] This is a placeholder for some notes on Judea Pearl and his causal machinery that I will upload. It’s part of an essay for a course called Rationality and Choice.
